dialogues.Kettner:
[1]Oh, hi Sweetie. 
[2]Okay Maury - we're all here. 
[3] 
[4]Hi sweetie! 
[5]You read my mind. 
[6]You two take it easy now. We have guests.  Eric honey, I'm sure if you apologize to Leroy, he'll take you back. 
[7]Eric! 
[8]Molly, I'm so sorry. 
[9]Well I hope you can hold onto this one pumpkin. When Marnie broke up with him he was devastated for months, the poor little guy. 
[10]You let us have some girl time. Take these downstairs to your dad. 
[11]Now don't be that way, boy. All your big brother is trying to say is that we're worried about you.
dialogues.Devon:
[1]Hey Kirk.    How you been holdin' up? 
[2]She's coming here?      She a cute gal? 
[3]One door closes, another door opens. 
[4]That's defeatist thinking. 
[5]Holy Frijole. 
[6]Atta boy Jackers! 
[7]Pretty impressive catch, Kirky. 
[8]Kirk, you deserve a gal like her. And Stainer, why don't you try to be a little more supportive. 
[9]Stainer!    Cool your jets, buster. 
[10]Stainer, that's just dirty pool. He's at least a four. 
[11]Kirk said she likes his Taurus. 
[12]A hard ten? 
[13]What about Rick Ocasek?   Billy Joel, Donald Trump... 
[14]What?   What's going on? 
[15]Excuse me? 
[16]Ahhhh No. 
[17]Well, what's wrong with her? 
[18]Well that could be anything. Did she say it was a birth defect? 
[19]Oh, wow. What if this is Patty's way of telling you that Molly is a man?
dialogues.Ron:
[1]Uh, oh - the ex. Awkward! (Ron and Mr. Kettner laugh) No! I'm just jack-assin' with you, pirate. Great to meet you. How you doing? 
[2]Right. Of course. I'm sorry about your grandmother. It's just so... Well, old people, you know, what are you gonna do? 
[3] ...and take a table on the crowded patio.  
[4]I did like you said Mr. K. 
[5]I got this, Kirk. Eric, before you go bad-mouthin' a whole group of people, you should know that my grandmother on my father's side is from Fresno. 
[6]You know, Molly, I'm a business owner myself. A little restaurant. 
[7]We serve food that people eat.   So - restaurant. 
[8]I'm coming! It was really fantastic to meet you Molly.   If you ever need a pizza... 
[9]Cripes Kirk! Crack a window in there pirate! HAHAHA! 
[10] He throws his hands up in the air and does a happy dance similar to the one he had done after their first kiss.  Stainer, Devon and Jack are around the corner as Stainer and Jack are smoking a bowl. Devon hears Kirk's celebration and peers around the corner. He waves the others over. The guys come around the front to join Kirk.  
[11]Hey Stainer. Hey Pirate, can you spot me a twenty. I want to get me one of them travel pillows.
dialogues.Jack:
[1]She sounded like a hell of a lady. 
[2]What was that all about? 
[3]Entrepreneur? Kirk, I know that guy. He owns a Pizza Hut. 
[4]Absolutely. Visualize it. 
[5]Oh shit.   Yeah, you're right. 
[6]Are we still bowling? 
[7]Oh, not even you, huh? 
[8]Bullshit.    Then what am I? 
[9]Fine, you're a five then. 
[10]Is there an artist exemption for being a jag-off? 
[11]So, if he were a millionaire? 
[12]That's terrible. 
[13]What if it's something really bad? 
[14]That's cool that you love her but it's pretty fucked up to be rooting for a harsh deformity.
[1]Oh, hi Sweetie. 
[2]Hi sweetie! 
[3]You two take it easy now. We have guests.  Eric honey, I'm sure if you apologize to Leroy, he'll take you back. 
[4]Eric! 
[5]Molly, I'm so sorry. 
[6]Well I hope you can hold onto this one pumpkin. When Marnie broke up with him he was devastated for months, the poor little guy. 
[7]You let us have some girl time. Take these downstairs to your dad.
dialogues.Debbie:
[1]We've got a wedding to pay for, Kirk and... 
[2]Don't get your panties in a wad, Kirk. He's just making conversation.  
[3]I'm getting a kick-ass dress made out of actual checkered flags and Eric is going to be in an orange tux with a big Home Depot logo on the back and Tony Stewart's number 20 on the shoulders.  
[4]Don't tell him what to do. (to Eric) You're doing fine, baby.
dialogues.Kirk:
[1]I don't know, Stainer. 
[2]It's not that. It's my Grandma. I'll probably be at the hospital for the next few nights. 
[3]She's hanging in there but it doesn't look good. 
[4]Hey there, Habib. 
[5]Yeah, sorry. I'll get you out of here quick. You off to Boston again? 
[6]I'm sorry.     It's just... 
[7]Okay, Habib, you're all set buddy. Have a good trip. 
[8]Morning. 
[9]Second trip in two days? 
[10]Well hang in there kiddo and I guess I'll see you tomorrow. 
[11]Hey Mom.   Hey Marnie. 
[12]Who's that guy Dad's with? 
[13]Sure.   It's fine. 
[14]I've been better. 
[15]Yeah.   Thanks. 
[16]Okay.   Well, I better get in there. 
[17]Okay, but you know Grammy didn't have all that much. Once the hospital and... and the ah... 
[18]Well, it's not going to leave enough to get worked up over. 
[19]Grammy, you really shouldn't... 
[20]I love you Grammy. 
[21]Why don't you just come on through, ma'am, and we'll see if anything sets off the machine. 
[22]This is Kirk Kettner. 
[23]No, no. It's not that.    I ah...I lost somebody today. 
[24]She used to be a blackjack dealer at the Horseshoe. When I was little, she taught me and my friends how to play poker. Turned us into a bunch of eight-year-old degenerate gamblers. 
[25]So, your grandmother too, huh? 
[26]Oh, God, I know. Grammy used to change her own oil. Right up until a few months ago. She was... Do you change your own oil? 
[27]I know, me neither. She could barley walk and I'd come over and find her lying under her Cadillac all covered in grease. 
[28]No, no.   Go catch your flight. 
[29]Kirk Kettner. 
[30]Oh, hi.   Molly McCall? 
[31]It's Kirk... From the coffee shop. You left your pictures with me. If you tell me which gate you're at, I can run them right down to you. 
[32]Okay, well I'll leave them at the lost and found and when you get... 
[33]Oh, sure.    But how will I... 
[34]It's been a rough week but, you know, all of the services and family stuff keep you pretty busy... I really miss her, though. 
[35]Hello?... Oh, Hi. I'm sorry I can barely hear you. I'm at a club and.... Club Vertigo? Oh, yeah - it's right down the street from there... Okay, sounds good. 
[36]Nothing, just a passenger. She accidentally left something with me. She's going to stop in and pick it up I guess. 
[37]Very. 
[38]No she doesn't.      Trust me. 
[39]No, seriously - it's nothing.      She's way out of my league. 
[40]Thanks.   Thanks, I'll be alright. 
[41]No.   It's not really my thing. 
[42]No.   Branson's...awesome. 
[43]No. You should go. I'm sure you'll have a great time. Totally. 
[44]Yeah. He seems like a good guy, though.  He's an entrepreneur. 
[45]So?   That's a business. 
[46]He's got more going on than I do. That's all I'm saying. 
[47]I appreciate what you guys are trying to do but, I'm telling you, I have zero chance with this one and I'm completely okay with that. 
[48]No it isn't. It's just like saying I'll never go to the moon and I'm okay with that too. 
[49]No. I'm saying that I never will go to the moon but I'm not going to get down about it because, you know - I never expected to. 
[50]I told you. 
[51]Here I am. 
[52]Oh, you know... Hey, these are my best friends - Jack, Devon and Stainer. 
[53]Oh. Here's your pictures - all safe and sound. 
[54]No trouble at all. 
[55]Um... 
[56]You don't have to pay me back. 
[57]A burger does sound good. (then to the guys) I'm going to just ah... 
[58]Don't worry. Believe me, I know. 
[59]What?     Oh, I'm not her brother. 
[60]You know what, a Bass sounds good. Make that two. 
[61]So... You know what I do, what about you? Your card said event planner. How'd you get into that? 
[62]Wow. 
[63]Oh, I don't know what that word means. What was it? 
[64]Oh, okay. No, I don't think that's so perni...gious? 
[65]Good - new word. No, not pernicious at all. Not if you enjoy the work. 
[66]Wow.   I love Billy Joel. 
[67]Oh man - That's my number one fear. I'm terrified of getting up in front of people. I'd rather get a Kentucky root canal. 
[68]Oh, yeah right! (Catches Molly's unspoken instructions.) But, yeah. I'm her boyfriend, I guess, so... 
[69]Honest mistake. 
[70]I drive a 94 Taurus. It's got AM/FM but I wouldn't call it a sports car per se. 
[71]So here's this little old lady trying to go through security with six pounds of weed in her girdle! 
[72]So, a duck walks into a bar... 
[73]No, thank you for dinner. I feel bad that you won't let me... 
[74] 
[75]Oh, right.     Thanks!   Thank you. 
[76]Hey, it's Molly.       She's here. 
[77]Oh, yeah.     Wouldn't miss it. 
[78]How 'bout that. So, we're going to grab some beers. Can we bring you ladies anything? Beer? Nachos? Patty, cotton candy? 
[79]Ooohhh! Okay! Okay! That makes sense, right!? When Molly was here I was like, "what!?" But, okay! Well, Patty seems cool. She's funny. 
[80]What does that mean? 
[81] 
[82]Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean... 
[83]No, this is my fault, I'll take care of it. 
[84]God, I'm really embarrassed. 
[85]What? How is that even possible? She's so...  
[86]Yeah.   I think I do.  
[87]Yeah, I suppose.  
[88]Oh.   Oh yeah?  
[89]No! Hey! None taken. I don't blame you. I know I'm no Brad Pitt. That's cool.  
[90]I'm sorry.     I didn't mean to assume anything.  
[91]Oh, yeah right! 
[92]But... why would... 
[93]Well, yeah. 
[94]She was hoping to set Patty up with you. 
[95]It's okay, she wasn't interested. 
[96]I don't know, Stainer, somebody got thrown out of the game and I had to drive him home, remember? 
[97]I can't argue with him. 
[98]Okay Stains, take it easy. 
[99]I can live with three. 
[100]What about your shitty car? 
[101]Stainer's right. Patty was probably just messing around. It's not a big deal. Let's just bowl. 
[102] 
[103]Holy crap.  She just asked me out for tomorrow night! 
[104] 
[105]You know what Willy. I honestly don't know how I'm doing. 
[106]I should be doing awesome but I don't know. Know what I mean? 
[107]How are you? 
[108]Who's that? 
[109]Thanks. I had trouble sleeping last night. This Molly thing... I don't want to want this, you know? It just seems too good to be true. I just don't get it. 
[110]I can't think of one.   Not one that makes any sense. 
[111]Please don't say she wants me to kill someone. 
[112]I came right from work. 
[113]Eric, it can't be much. 
[114]It's okay.     I had it in savings. 
[115]Anyway... Grammy hated owing anyone money. I'm afraid she couldn't rest if she wasn't square with the house. It's the least I can do. She practically raised me. 
[116]Yeah, I get that a lot too. I'm sure the next one will be for me. 
[117]So you two work together? 
[118]Oh, boy.   I guess I better... 
[119]Stupid.    Stupid. Stupid. 
[120]Oh, Hi. 
[121]My portfolio? I don't really... 
[122]My means. 
[123]Oh, sure.    Is everything all right? 
[124]Okay.   Did I... 
[125]What? I'm not paying anyone. We're just on a date. 
[126]Oh, no.   Did I miss Talon? 
[127]Yeah. Super. He, uh, seems like a great guy. 
[128] 
[129]Yeah, I'm gonna move to a better place pretty soon. 
[130] It's Friday night and several college parties are raging in the complex. Kirk leads Molly up the stairs and down the balcony hall toward his door. They pass a few college students on the way; a couple making out, a guy vomiting in a bush. Two apartment windows are covered with tapestries of Bob Marley and a giant pot leaf.  
[131] Kirk and Molly enter.   The apartment is neat, clean and fairly sparse.  
[132]It's not much, I know. 
[133]What?   It's a good movie. 
[134]You like Cheap Trick? 
[135]A little. My grandma taught me. It was kind of our thing. She was a great player. Ragtime, show tunes, that kind of thing. I'm really not very good. 
[136]No, I can't really play in front of people. 
[137]No, I really can't. Trust me, you're not missing anything. 
[138]Nope. Almost did once. A talent show in high school. I just sat up there drenched in sweat. I really thought I could do it but then I made my big mistake. 
[139]Yep. All these eyes on me. I'm shaking, my head is spinning, I'm trying to remember if I even play the piano... and then, I puked. 
[140]INTO the piano actually. 
[141]It was a reflex. I was trying not to barf on the floor. Turns out it's a lot easier to clean puke off a stage than out of a baby grand. 
[142]Sorry. I'm a little cotton-mouthed. I'm going to get a glass of water. How 'bout for you? Water? A nice glass of, you know...water? 
[143] He pours a glass of water. He's about to return when he sees his reflection in the window. The boner under his khakis is not subtle. He looks down and starts to panic.  
[144]Um... You want anything to eat? 
[145]Oh come on! 
[146]No.   I got it! 
[147] 
[148]Really? 
[149] The boner pops back up. Kirk silently mouths, "MOTHERFUCKER!" at his mischievous little man.  
[150]Sure! Sure! Yeah! No problem! Great! That's...that's great! Ice!? You want some ice!? 
[151] Molly gets cozy on the couch and looks even sexier.  
[152]Shit! 
[153]Yeah, fine. 
[154] Kirk runs the water while he digs under the sink. He finds duct tape. He pulls some tape off the roll. It makes a loud noise that causes Molly to pause and Kirk to tense up. Kirk opens his pants and begins taping down the trouble-spot. He coughs hard to cover each subsequent tug of the tape roll.  
[155]Oh, dear God. 
[156] Kirk returns with two glasses of water and no visible boner.  
[157]Hey.   I'm totally fine with that. 
[158]Great! 
[159] As Molly exits, she gives him one last kiss. Two studly male college students are playing foosball on their patio. They stop when one points out the hottie who's kissing Kirk. Molly trots off.  
[160]No thanks fellas. 
[161] He drifts over to his piano and sits down. The joy of what has just happened is plastered on his face. He launches into a furiously happy Jerry Lee Lewis style romp. Soon a neighbor is pounding on the wall. Kirk stops playing.  
[162]Sorry, Mrs. Neusbaum! 
[163]Ron seems like a swell guy. I love Pizza Hut. What? Who's this? Why, this is my girlfriend, Molly. Oh, don't be that way. Oh, there, there, now. Here's a tissue. 
[164] Kirk lies in bed staring at the ceiling fan. The smile continues as he drifts off to sleep. Time lapses as Kirk sleeps and the sun comes up. Still smiling, his eyes open like a shot and he reaches for his phone - "No Missed Calls."  
[165] He stands in the shower sulking. He hears the phone ring in the next room. He jumps out, grabs a small towel and starts to dry off as he runs into the bedroom. He reaches the charger base but the phone is not there. He stands and listens hard to the ringing. He runs into the living room. Angle on the phone. It's hiding under a pillow on the couch. In the background, Kirk rushes around the room flipping up papers and magazines. The phone keeps ringing and Kirk's panic increases until he finally spots the phone. Kirk dives for it, losing his towel in the process.  
[166]Hello!?   Hello!? 
[167]Sorry, Mrs. Nuesbaum. 
[168]Yeah, but Stainer, she was the one who asked me out. So, why... 
[169]No, I didn't think I had a chance. 
[170]So I gotta get back to that. 
[171]So I'll have to fake it? 
[172]Maybe just a salad. 
[173]I know. But I got dinner with my folks later. 
[174]Sorry, Eric's not coming tonight. 
[175]You know what - this is ridiculous. I'm just going to call her. 
[176]No, she broke up with him. 
[177]So what am I supposed to do? 
[178]You're probably right. 
[179]No, you're right. You know what - it's good. It's better. I'm actually relieved. You should have seen this Talon guy. Man! All I've been thinking about is having to be naked in front of her. I don't need that kind of pressure. 
[180]Cut it out! 
[181]Hello!?... Oh, no problem! Yeah I was super busy yesterday anyway. 
[182]Well, I have dinner with my folks tonight... Oh, I wouldn't want to subject you to them... Okay. If you want to. I can pick you up... 
[183]Oh, sure. Well then let me call you back in a few minutes and I'll give you directions. Alrighty. Yeah. Buh-bye. 
[184]No. Eric's not going to be there. It's going to be good. You might be wrong about Molly. She might... 
[185] Molly drives up and stops in front of a small home on a quaint residential street.    She climbs out of her car, checking the address on a small sheet of paper. She sees Kirk sitting on the front porch.  
[186]You found it! 
[187]I'm sorry. My folks aren't back yet. We're locked out. 
[188]No. My dad's kind of obsessed with home-security. Like someone's going to break in and steal his Reader's Digest collection. 
[189]Hi, Mr. Riley! 
[190]Hey, what do say you take the night off and I'll take Noodle around the block for you?  Are you up for a walk? 
[191] 
[192]It's no trouble at all. 
[193] 
[194]Hey, you know what I'm thinking, let's go get Chinese. 
[195] Kirk comes through the front door to find his father in the living room watching a hockey game.     
[196]Hey dad. 
[197]Hey Eric. I thought you were hanging drywall tonight. 
[198]Okay, listen, I brought a date tonight. I really like her. Please don't embarrass me in front of her. I'll do anything you want. 
[199]Oh, hey Ron. So Marnie's here? 
[200]Everyone, this is Molly McCall. 
[201] Kirk, Molly, Mr. & Mrs. Kettner, Marnie, Ron and Debbie sit around the kitchen table and feast on a meatloaf dinner. Eric is at the fridge grabbing a beer. Marnie is angrily watching Ron whose eyes are all over Molly.  
[202]Geeze Eric! 
[203]There's a little more to it than that, Eric. Molly handles some big events. She's even doing a benefit with Billy Joel next month. 
[204]Dad, could you...  
[205]Eric, please.  
[206] Kirk splashes water on his face and then looks for a towel but can't find one. He's forced to use his sleeve. He is a wreck. He takes a deep breath and steps out into...  
[207] ...to find Marnie at the front door putting her coat on.  
[208]Are you heading home? 
[209]Thanks.   You do too.

[211]Molly, you don't have to do that. 
[212] Kirk's father has built a tacky little basement bar decorated with neon beer signs and Eric's old trophies and ribbons. Mr. Kettner and Debbie sit at the bar and smoke as Eric stands behind the bar and serves them cocktails. Kirk comes down the basement stairs and joins them. The hockey game wrap-up highlights are running on a TV mounted above the bar.

dialogues.Marnie:
[1]Kirk, you've been really great about your mom and I staying so close since we broke up but I know how much Grammy meant to you... Well, is it okay with you that I'm here? 
[2]Okay, good. Then can I introduce you to my new boyfriend? 
[3]Ron, this is Kirk.

[5]Kirk, I'm sorry about Grammy. 
[6]I realize she was never that crazy about me but I know how much you loved her and I hope you're okay. 
[7]Listen, are you going to Branson with your folks next month?

[19]Why not? Please don't say it's because of this Molly person. 
[20]Good. I was really worried about you with her. She seems like kind of a bitch.

[24]I'm not going to risk being all alone just because you don't know what's good for you. Come on, Kirk. Deep down, you know where you belong. 
[25]Come on, Kirk. 
[26] 
[27]What difference does that make!? 
[28]Fine. We're not in the A group but we're still getting on next. 
[29]Hit him Kirk! Or else I will!

Kirk, please understand that if you commit this money, we will all be eternally grateful and I think your grandmother will be very proud of you... But it doesn't change anything between you and me.

[12]A knockout like Molly be interested in a spud like you? 
[13]Got me. Again, no offense. But listen, Kirk, your dream girl just showed up. Try not to blow it. 
[14]Here they come! Everybody hide! 
[15]Listen, Molly would kill me if she knew I was telling you this but I'm trying to do you a favor. 
[16]Molly has this physical...um issue. You know, kind of like a birth defect? 
[17]It's not a big deal but she's really self-conscious about it. Talon and some other guys she's dated have been weirded out and made her feel like a freak. 
[18]It's better if she tells you but if you can't deal with it, just get lost now and don't put her through that heartbreak again. 
[19]Good. 'Cause if you do, it'll be your last conscious act... (she stands) Cake? 
[20]You got some big red apples showing your face around here again. 
[21]No.     Get lost. 
[22]Oh, for Christ sake! This one too!? 
[23]I'm warning you both - Molly has been through enough. You go near her and I will fuck you all the way up! Understand!? 
[24]Who's your Mommy!?   Come on!   Who's your Mommy!? 
[25]That's right! Patty is, isn't she! 
[26]You shut your hole!  What happened? 
[27]Every time you say you're sorry, dumbshit here gets his bell rung. 
[28]It's too late for this shit, Kirk. 
[29]I thought she was a blackjack dealer. 
[30]Wow. So, what does this have to do with Molly? 
[31]So, what, now you can afford her!? 
[32]You know what, Kirk - I told Molly you were different but you're just as shallow and full of shit as the rest of them, aren't you? 
[33]Leslie! We're not here to feed these people, we're here to cure fucking cancer! 
[34]Now I want every one of those motherfuckers back there taking bids in fifteen - out! 
[35]Lady, he just gave three million dollars. He can go up there and try to blow himself for all I care.
dialogues.Katie:
[1]It's so nice to meet you, I've heard great things. 
[2]May I? 
[3]Robert!    Is Jerry with you? 
[4]It's so nice you came. These are two of my star pupils, Robert and Jerry. Boys, this is my sister, Molly. 
[5]I wish Kirk would play the piano for me. 
[6]Come on, Kirk! For my birthday? 
[7]Who's this from?
